StoryElement.StoryElement: [Robby regains consciousness and realizes he’s in a room lying on the floor. A fluffy white comforter covers his body. The room is dark except for the glow of moonlight coming in through the window. In the moonlight he sees someone on another futon lying next to him. It’s Junko.]
ROBBY: Must be back in the room. Let me just check. Yup, still just a bathing suit. Is that Junko? Let me just get a closer look.
[Junko wakes up.]
JUNKO: Robby? Eeek . . . Are you OK? How is your head?

StoryInteraction.StoryInteraction: I was just getting a closer making sure I wasn’t in the wrong room.

StoryResponse.StoryResponse: JUNKO: This is the right room.

StoryElement.StoryElement: ROBBY: Anyway, my head feels better thanks. What happened?
JUNKO: Mariko found you and brought you here.
ROBBY: All by herself?

JUNKO: Actually we all helped. But because of you, her boss got really mad at her. He thinks a half naked foreigner running around doesn’t look good to all the distinguished guests they have staying here.
ROBBY: So it’s our last night?
JUNKO: Actually we’re not supposed to be here. Mariko told her boss she would take you to the hospital, but I convinced her to let us stay here.
ROBBY: Why? If they don’t want us here we should go. I saw this documentary about POW camps in Japan . . .
JUNKO: I thought we could have one night alone in this room. What do you think?
ROBBY: That’s a good point. How did you convince Mariko to let us stay?
JUNKO: I told her we would pay the full price for the room. You have a credit card right?
ROBBY: Quick, let’s tie some bed sheets together. We’ll go out that window!
JUNKO: We can’t go out that window!
JUNKO: Don’t you want to stay here with me?

StoryInteraction.StoryInteraction: I just thinking we could pack our things and take a nice romantic walk in the garden.

StoryResponse.StoryResponse: JUNKO: Good, why don’t you come closer?
JUNKO: Oh that sounds nice. Why don’t we do that a little later?

StoryElement.StoryElement: ROBBY: I have something I want to tell you.
JUNKO: Let’s talk about it over a nice cold bottle of soda.
ROBBY: Don’t touch that refrigerator!
JUNKO: What’s wrong?
ROBBY: I don’t have enough money to pay for all of this.
JUNKO: But you’re an American. Where’s your big credit card?
ROBBY: Hey, we don’t all have big credit cards. Some of us have small credit cards and some don’t have any at all. What am I saying? Let’s get out of here. Get your bag and let’s go.
JUNKO: Well I’m not ready to escape! This is the first moment alone we’ve had and all you can think about is running away?
ROBBY: I’m sorry Junko I have to go. I don’t want to get caught doing something stupid and lose my student visa. I haven’t even started school yet!
JUNKO: Fine just go.

StoryInteraction.StoryInteraction: It's your last chance are you coming or not?

StoryResponse.StoryResponse: [Junko pulls the sheet over her head.]

StoryElement.StoryElement: ROBBY: That was stupid. Why did I say that? I should have just lied and said everything was fine. Maybe I could have just left later while she was asleep and she’d never know. It would be like a dream for her. Yeah, some dream I am. Anyway, damage is done. I’ve got my bag. I’ve gotta get out of here.
[Robby slips out the door of the room into the hall.]
